snippet: The National Security Agency is recording all phone calls and their routing data in one foreign country and retaining that data for a month so that it can be analyzed, according to a report based on a document leaked by Edward J. Snowden.
abstract: Report based on document leaked by Edward J Snowden says National Security Agency is recording all phone calls and their routing data in one foreign country and retaining that data for a month so that it can be analyzed; classified document also indicates that similar but less comprehensive efforts exist in at least four other foreign countries.
lead_paragraph: The National Security Agency is recording all phone calls and their routing data in one foreign country and retaining that data for a month so that it can be analyzed, according to a report based on a document leaked by Edward J. Snowden.

headline.main: Leaked File Details U.S. Phone Monitoring Abroad
headline.print_headline: Leaked File Details U.S. Phone Monitoring Abroad

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
